etymology: From Ottoman Turkish آیری (ayrı) or آیرو (ayru), from Proto-Turkic *adruk (“split, separate”), from *adïr- (“to separate”), morphologically ayır- + -ı (deverbal nominal suffix). Cognates with Azerbaijani ayrı, Bashkir айырым (ayırım), Crimean Tatar ayrı, Kazakh айырым (aiyrym), Kyrgyz айры (ayrı), Southern Altai айры (ayrï), Tatar аерым (ayırım), Turkmen aýry, Uyghur ئايرىم (ayrim), Uzbek ayrim.
